channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Putin sorry for Lavrov's claim Hitler was part Jewish - Israel PM
item.description: Russia's foreign minister claimed that Nazi leader Adolf Hitler had Jewish blood, sparking outrage.

item.title: Ukraine war has dragged on, admits Putin ally Lukashenko
item.description: Belarus's authoritarian leader Lukashenko has defended the war but wants it to end.

item.title: Karine Jean-Pierre: White House names first black press secretary
item.description: Karine Jean-Pierre will replace Jen Psaki in the top role at the end of next week.

item.title: CCTV captures Kansas tornado churning in car park
item.description: An surveillance camera captures a tornado forming and sweeping through Andover.

item.title: Elad attack: Three dead in central Israeli city
item.description: Police say the incident is a suspected terror attack, which follows a surge in violence.

item.title: Kenya alarm after carrier bag mistaken for stray lion
item.description: The Kenyan villagers were on alert after some of their livestock had recently gone missing.

item.title: Madison Cawthorn: US lawmaker 'won't back down' after naked tape leak
item.description: "We were acting foolish, and joking. That's it," says Madison Cawthorn, the youngest US congressman.

item.title: China building collapse: Woman rescued from rubble after six days
item.description: The collapse of a building in the city of Changsha is now known to have killed at least 26 people.

item.title: Jealous Depp kicked me over Franco 'affair' - Heard
item.description: Amber Heard says jealousy of actor James Franco sent Johnny Depp into a rage on a plane.

item.title: Senegal midwives go on trial in Louga over Astou Sokhna's death
item.description: Astou Sokhna died after reportedly being refused a Caesarean, sparking a national outcry.

item.title: Turkey's cost of living soars nearly 70%
item.description: Everyday goods including food and transport costs have seen among the biggest annual increases.

item.title: Covid: World’s true pandemic death toll nearly 15 million, says WHO
item.description: These include deaths from Covid and from the indirect effects of the pandemic over two years worldwide.

item.title: 'There's power in names': Antigua unearths lost ancestors
item.description: A landmark genealogy project is unearthing the names of enslaved people whose stories were erased.

item.title: Why 9 May Victory Day is so important for Russia
item.description: Vladimir Putin has made it an annual event, but amid war in Ukraine 9 May has taken on new significance.

item.title: Wealthy Russians flee to Dubai to avoid sanctions
item.description: Property purchases by Russians in Dubai surged by 67% in the first quarter of 2022, a report says.

item.title: Myanmar civil war: ‘I saw my son’s body on Facebook’
item.description: After the Myanmar military entered his village, Joseph fled into the jungle but his 13-year-old was killed.

item.title: Africa's digital business: The women swapping shops for smartphones
item.description: Three African women explain how they have boosted their income by going digital since Covid.

item.title: Bill Gates on Elon Musk feud and Jeffrey Epstein meetings
item.description: The Microsoft tycoon talks to the BBC about divorce, conspiracy theories and Elon Musk.

item.title: Russia rehearses World War Two victory parade
item.description: Military vehicles, weapons and soldiers were on display at a rehearsal for Russia's Victory Day parade.

item.title: Dust storm and wildfires seen from space
item.description: Satellite images show gusts of up to 60mph blowing dust across Colorado and plumes of smoke in New Mexico.

item.title: Disabled children 'dumped' in Ukrainian institutions
item.description: Thousands of disabled Ukrainian children reportedly left in institutions that can’t care for them.

item.title: Durban floods survivors: 'I thought the world was ending'
item.description: Moeketsi Manake and his family talk about losing everything, including their house, in the Durban floods.

item.title: Hungary will veto EU oil ban proposal - minister
item.description: Zoltán Kovács says the proposal is against the country's interests and would ruin the Hungarian economy.
